messages.content: Zastrzegam sobie prawo do zmiany mojej opinii w przyszłości w zależności od nowych informacji, danych czy doświadczeń.

Sprawdź tekst po angielsku "We conducted our audit procedures in accordance with International Standards of Auditing. In accordance with a Full Scope engagement, we planned and performed our audit procedures to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. A Full Scope engagement involves examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts in the financial statements. It also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management.
In accordance with the Moore Stephens LLP Group Audit Instructions dated 27 July 2023, the scope of our audit procedures was established based on our level of materiality, established to obtain reasonable assurance as to whether the financial statements contain misstatements that exceed 1 720 000 PLN in the aggregate.
We conclude, based on the specified materiality, that for the sole purpose of inclusion in the consolidation of YSQ International Pte. Ltd. and group companies, the financial statements referred to above have been prepared in accordance with IFRS, Reporting  Package Instructions and Moore Stephens LLP Group Audit Instructions. 
"

"We would like to emphasize that our audit procedures were conducted in accordance with International Standards of Auditing. Our aim, through a Full Scope engagement, was to obtain reasonable assurance regarding the absence of material misstatements in the financial statements. This involved examining supporting evidence for the amounts presented in the financial statements on a sample basis, as well as evaluating the accounting principles and significant estimates made by management.

Our audit procedures were determined based on our established level of materiality, as per the guidelines provided in the Moore Stephens LLP Group Audit Instructions dated 27 July 2023. This was done to ensure that our procedures were designed to detect misstatements exceeding the aggregate amount of 1,720,000 PLN.

Based on the specified materiality, we conclude that, with regards to the consolidation of YSQ International Pte. Ltd. and group companies, the aforementioned financial statements have been prepared in accordance with IFRS, Reporting Package Instructions, and the Moore Stephens LLP Group Audit Instructions."
